recap_documents.description: OPINION AND ORDER: re: (60 in 1:17-cv-06087-JPO) MOTION to Dismiss the First Amended Complaint filed by Wells Fargo Delaware Trust Company, NA, Wells Fargo Bank, N.A., Wells Fargo Bank NorthWest, N.A., ATC Realty Fifteen, Inc., (49 in 1:18-cv-02416-JPO) MOTION to Dismiss filed by Wells Fargo Bank Northwest N.A., Wells Fargo Delaware Trust Company, Wells Fargo Bank N.A., ATC Realty Fifteen, Inc, (29 in 1:18-cv-00128-JPO) MOTION to Dismiss filed by S&P Global, Inc., (58 in 1:17-cv-06087-JPO) MOTION to Dismiss filed by S&P Global, Inc., (55 in 1:17-cv-07034-JPO) MOTION to Dismiss filed by S&P Global, Inc., (91 in 1:17-cv-02987-JPO) MOTION to Dismiss filed by John Marcum, Roy G Smith, Portsmouth Settlement Company I LLC, (86 in 1:17-cv-02987-JPO) MOTION to Dismiss filed by S&P Global, Inc., (54 in 1:18-cv-02416-JPO) MOTION to Dismiss filed by Roy G. Smith, John Marcum, Portsmouth Settlement Company I, LLC, (57 in 1:17-cv-07034-JPO) MOTION to Dismiss the First Amended Complaint filed by Wells Fargo Delaware Trust Company, Wells Fargo Bank Northwest, N.A., Wells Fargo Bank, N.A., ATC Realty Fifteen, Inc., (31 in 1:18-cv-00128-JPO) MOTION to Dismiss the Original Complaint filed by Wells Fargo Bank Northwest N.A., Wells Fargo Delaware Trust Company, Wells Fargo Bank, N.A., ATC Realty Fifteen Inc., (34 in 1:18-cv-00128-JPO) MOTION to Dismiss filed by John Marcum, Roy G. Smith, Portsmouth Settlement Company 1, LLC, (47 in 1:18-cv-02416-JPO) MOTION to Dismiss filed by S&P Global, Inc., (63 in 1:17-cv-06087-JPO) MOTION to Dismiss filed by John Marcum, Roy G Smith, Portsmouth Settlement Company I, LLC, (60 in 1:17-cv-07034-JPO) MOTION to Dismiss Plaintiffs' Second Amended Complaint filed by Roy G. Smith, John Marcum, Portsmouth Settlement Company I, LLC, (88 in 1:17-cv-02987-JPO) FIRST MOTION to Dismiss the Second Amended Class Action Complaint filed by Wells Fargo Delaware Trust Company, NA, Wells Fargo Bank, N.A., Wells Fargo Bank NorthWest, N.A., ATC Realty Fifteen, Inc. For the foregoing reasons, S&P, the Lifetrade Movants, and the Wells Fargo Defendants' motions to dismiss are GRANTED in part and DENIED in part. All claims against Portsmouth are dismissed for lack of personal jurisdiction. Counts One, Two, Four, Five, Six, Seven, Eight, Fourteen, Fifteen, Sixteen, Eighteen, Nineteen, and Twenty-One are dismissed in full. Counts Nine, Ten, Seventeen, and Twenty are dismissed as to those Plaintiffs who invested in the Lifetrade Funds prior to April 24, 2011. And Counts Three, Eleven, Twelve, Thirteen, Twenty-Two, Twenty-Three, and Twenty-Four survive in full. Defendants shall file their answers to the remaining claims within 21 days of the date of this Opinion and Order. The Clerk of Court is directed to close the following motions: Docket Numbers 86, 88, and 91 in Aviles, No. 17 Civ. 2987; Docket Numbers 58, 60, and 63 in Benedetto, No. 17 Civ. 6087; Docket Numbers 55, 57, and 60 in Acebedo, No. 17 Civ. 7034; Docket Numbers 29, 31, and 34 in Alvarez, No. 18 Civ. 128; and Docket Numbers 47, 49, and 54 in Areco, No. 18 Civ. 2416. SO ORDERED. (Signed by Judge J. Paul Oetken on 3/28/2019) (ama) (Entered: 03/28/2019)

   Since Rodriguee,   this Court has not addressed the right to be present
during the critical response-formulation stage. The Appellate Divisions,
however, are split. Erroneously relying on Rodriguez, the Fourth and now
First Departments have rejected the right to be present during the
formulation stage. People u. Ha,rrell, 168 A.D.3d 591, 59L (Lst Dept. 2079);
